documentation.xhtml:p: tune2 generates an output signal which is set by input switches.
Output current execution time in microseconds
TC_S delivers the time it was last called on the output TC in seconds

ST.xhtml:p:
BIT_OF_DWORD := (SHR(in,N) AND 16#00000001) > 0;
(* From Oscat Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function extracts a single bit from the nth position from right (right is lowest bit the lowest Bit (Bit0 from in) is selected with N=.

ST.xhtml:p: inc := (X + _D + M + 1) MOD (M + 1); (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: This is a increment function which increments the input X by the value D and compares the result with M. if the output exceeds M it will continue to count from 0 again.
this function loads a bit into a byte at position pos.
Output current execution time in miliseconds
TP_2 generates a pulse every time it is calles with in := TRUE.
driver_1 is a multi purpose driver
driver_4 is a multi purpose driver.
driver_4C is a multi purpose driver
FLOW_CONTROL switches a valves depending on the input in
FT_Profile generates an output signal which is defined by values over a time scale
incremental decoder with quadruple accuracy.
INTERLOCK has two inputs I1 and I2 which drive the corresponding outputs Q1 and Q2
INTERLOCK_4 detects one of 4 switches and delivers the number of the switch pressed on the output out

ST.xhtml:p:
MANUAL := NOT OFF AND (IN OR _ON);
(*From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: MANUAL is a manual override for digital signals
MANUAL_1 is a manual override for digital signals.
MANUAL_2 is a manual override for boolean signals
MANUAL_4 is a manual override for digital signals

ST.xhtml:p:
_BYTE_TO_INT := USINT_TO_INT(BYTE_TO_USINT(IN));
(*From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function generates an output signal according to a bit pattern
this function generates one out of 4 signals specified by bit patterns
RAMPS generates output signal which are slew rate and acceleration controlled
tune generates an output signal which is set by input switches
